title: PSA Group
summary: The PSA Group (French pronunciation: ​[ɡʁup pe ɛs ɑ]), legally known as Peugeot S.A. (Peugeot Société Anonyme, trading as Groupe PSA; formerly known as PSA Peugeot Citroën from 1991 to 2016), was a French multinational automotive manufacturing company which produced automobiles and motorcycles under the Peugeot, Citroën, DS, Opel and Vauxhall brands.[7][8] On 18 December 2019, PSA and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles announced that they had agreed to the terms of a binding $50 billion merger,[9][10] which as of mid-2020 was pending approval by European competition regulators.[11][12] On 16 July 2020, both companies announced its new name for their merged operations, Stellantis.[13] The name Stellantis is derived from the Latin verb "stello" which means "to brighten with stars". The deal was closed on 16 January 2021.
